segment.source: Creating a log file for the code analysis tool
segment.target: Creating a log file for the code analysis tool

segment.source: The Windows Server 2012 Hardware Certification Program requires a Driver Verification Log (DVL) for all applicable driver submissions.
segment.target: The Windows Server 2012 Hardware Certification Program requires a Driver Verification Log (DVL) for all applicable driver submissions.

segment.source: You must run the Code Analysis tool prior to creating a DVL for your driver.
segment.target: You must run the Code Analysis tool prior to creating a DVL for your driver.

segment.source: The DVL contains a summary of the results from the Code Analysis and Static Driver Verifier log files.
segment.target: The DVL contains a summary of the results from the Code Analysis and Static Driver Verifier log files.

segment.source: The log files do not contain source code information.
segment.target: The log files do not contain source code information.

segment.source: To run code analysis on the driver
segment.target: To run code analysis on the driver

segment.source: In Microsoft Visual Studio Ultimate 2012, select the driver project file and then right-click to open the project properties.
segment.target: In Microsoft Visual Studio Ultimate 2012, select the driver project file and then right-click to open the project properties.

segment.source: Select Windows 8 Release as the Configuration and x64 as the Platform.
segment.target: Select Windows 8 Release as the Configuration and x64 as the Platform.

segment.source: From the Analyze or Build menu, click Run Code Analysis on Solution.
segment.target: From the Analyze or Build menu, click Run Code Analysis on Solution.

segment.source: If errors or warnings are found, use the Code Analysis Report window to investigate the cause of the errors.
segment.target: If errors or warnings are found, use the Code Analysis Report window to investigate the cause of the errors.

segment.source: Use the warning messages to fix those problems.
segment.target: Use the warning messages to fix those problems.

segment.source: For more information about the Code Analysis tool, see How to run Code Analysis for drivers and Analyzing C/C++ Code Quality by Using Code Analysis.
segment.target: For more information about the Code Analysis tool, see How to run Code Analysis for drivers and Analyzing C/C++ Code Quality by Using Code Analysis.

segment.source: The Code Analysis tool for drivers writes the results to the file vc.nativecodeanalysis.all.xml in the build configuration and platform sub-directory of your project, for example, \\Windows 8Release\\x64.
segment.target: The Code Analysis tool for drivers writes the results to the file vc.nativecodeanalysis.all.xml in the build configuration and platform sub-directory of your project, for example, \\Windows 8Release\\x64.

segment.source: Remarks
segment.target: Remarks

segment.source: Code Analysis for Drivers is a compile-time static verification tool that detects basic coding errors in C and C++ programs and includes a specialized module that is designed to detect errors in (primarily) kernel-mode driver code.
segment.target: Code Analysis for Drivers is a compile-time static verification tool that detects basic coding errors in C and C++ programs and includes a specialized module that is designed to detect errors in (primarily) kernel-mode driver code.

segment.source: In previous versions of the WDK, the driver-specific module for code analysis was part of a stand-alone tool called PREfast for Drivers (PFD).
segment.target: In previous versions of the WDK, the driver-specific module for code analysis was part of a stand-alone tool called PREfast for Drivers (PFD).

segment.source: You can also run the Code Analysis tool from a Visual Studio Command Prompt window.
segment.target: You can also run the Code Analysis tool from a Visual Studio Command Prompt window.

segment.source: Set up the environment by running one of the following batch files.
segment.target: Set up the environment by running one of the following batch files.

segment.source: -Or-
segment.target: -Or-

segment.source: Run the Code Analysis tool.
segment.target: Run the Code Analysis tool.

segment.source: For the most up-to-date information about the requirements for the Driver Verification Log, refer to the WDK Release Notes.
segment.target: For the most up-to-date information about the requirements for the Driver Verification Log, refer to the WDK Release Notes.
